text:
I use jdk 1.4.1 and create a new .jmx file and tried to opened it, but it is 
not possible I get an failure dialog and this error:
***Parsing Fatal Error**
 Line:   1
 URI:    
 Message: The root element is required in a well-formed document.


org.xml.sax.SAXException: Fatal Error encountered
        at org.apache.jmeter.save.old.xml.XmlHandler.fatalError
(XmlHandler.java:126)
        at org.apache.xerces.framework.XMLParser.reportError
(XMLParser.java:1242)
        at org.apache.xerces.framework.XMLDocumentScanner.reportFatalXMLError
(XMLDocumentScanner.java:570)
        at 
org.apache.xerces.framework.XMLDocumentScanner$XMLDeclDispatcher.endOfInput
(XMLDocumentScanner.java:790)
        at org.apache.xerces.framework.XMLDocumentScanner.endOfInput
(XMLDocumentScanner.java:418)

maybe this bug is always known?
creator: jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
text:
Created attachment 2772
the full java errror

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
I don't have this problem.  It appears you've got a corrupted .jmx file.  Can
you send me a copy of the .jmx it creates, or make it an attachment to this bug?

the .jmx has 0 Byte, but the better thing is, I tried it now again and it 
works. The only thing is, if I now tried to open an .jmx that I created on the 
19 august, JMeter does nothing and throws Java Errors.
creator: jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
text:
Created attachment 2778
the log from the opening an 1 day old .jmx

creator: jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
text:
Created attachment 2787
the .jmx without the Http Default request

creator: Rittmeyer@online.de
text:
I guess you had an element in your older jmx-file that referenced 
"org.apache.jmeter.assertions.Assertion". This has changed to an interface that 
is now implemented by ResponseAssertion. Please try to change 
"org.apache.jmeter.assertions.Assertion" to 
"org.apache.jmeter.assertions.ResponseAssertion" in the jmx-file. I suppose 
JMeter will import it without problems  after that.

If I try to save this .jmx (attachments 10:33) with an http default request and 
than I get the java error ("save error").
creator: jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
text: I created the .jmx really _new_ with this version of JMeter (cvs 20.8.2002).

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
I downloaded your testplan and it loaded fine.  I added an HTTP request
defaults, and that worked fine too.

and if you can save that all? the .jmx file with the http default request? hmm, 
I can reproduce it.
creator: jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
text: ok, I was loading a new cvs version and it works fine.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
